meanings.sent1: After making a mistake, she tried resetting the puzzle to start over.
meanings.sent2: He enjoys resetting his computer to fix any issues that arise.
meanings.sent3: The cat kept resetting the toy mouse, thinking it would move on its own.
meanings.sent4: Resetting the clock of life is like turning back time to correct errors.
meanings.sent5: The mechanic explained the importance of resetting the engine for optimal performance.

meanings.definition: The action of setting again or differently
meanings.sent1: The resetting of the alarm clock was necessary after the power outage.
meanings.sent2: She observed the resetting of the stage props for the next act.
meanings.sent3: The resetting of the thermostat caused confusion among the housemates.
meanings.sent4: In the game, the resetting of the level unlocked new challenges.
meanings.sent5: The resetting of the password was a simple task for the IT specialist.
